def_cn: (发生事故后)报废的车辆
def_en: Something such as a vehicle that is a write-off has been so badly damaged in an accident that it is not worth repairing.

def_cn: (债务或花费的)注销，勾销
def_en: A write-off is the decision by a company or government to accept that they will never recover a debt or an amount of money that has been spent on something.

def_cn: 失败的计划;白费的时间
def_en: If you describe a plan or period of time as a write-off, you mean that it has been a failure and you have achieved nothing.
